cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/The Hideout

text.content:
The Poacher's Hideout

Accessible via a crumbling ruin and an old stair case, the Poacher's Hideout consists of a subterranean complex for a small band of poachers hunting local wildlife and a small cave system complete with mystical flora and fungi.

 

While the Poacher's Hideout is designed to be first entered by players via a drop into the ruined tower in the bottom left corrner of the scene, players could also enter througha hidden structure in the wilderness to find the staircase down into the Hideout in the top left portion of the map as well.

 

5e System users will find Quick Encounters throughout the map. The party may have been hired by a local town or noble to root out the poachers killing rare beasts, or they could be on the trail of the same rare component as the poachers themselves. 

 

The encounters provided are generally suitable for a party of four between levels 1 and 3. Encounters can be made more difficult by allowing enemies to overhear and react from rooms more quickly. There is also a potential diplomatic encounter in the form of the ghost's tomb in the bottom right corner of the map. This makes the map well suited for a short quest or one shot.

 

Modules In Use:

Quick Encounters for 5e encounters. Non-5e users will still be able to read the story prompts of the journal notes, but won't have taillor-made encounters.

Scene Packer to preserve Quick Encounter positional data and make unpacking the scene smooth.

Monk's Active Tile Triggers to power the opening and closing of the crypt door.

 

 

Other Suggestions

MAKE IT YOURS Use the cabal modular dungeon to add additional rooms, passageways, or traps.
BRING IT TO LIFE Grab the Baileywiki Modular System to create a town and wilderness near the Hideout to suit your one shot or game.

text.content:
Your tokens (and/or tiles) and their positions have been saved in this Journal Entry and replaced with a single Quick Encounter Note. To run the Quick Encounter, double-click the Map Note icon and then click the Run Quick Encounter button.

Quick Encounter

Making their way through the strands of this hall, the party  can't shake the feeling of being watched... by many eyes. Despite their efforts to tread carefully, they've disturbed the swarms of spiders and drawn the ire of the hall's larger eight-legged denizens.

 

  • 2@Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.v99wOosUJjUgcUNF]{Giant Spider} (200XP each)
  • 3@Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.f9JbhBfWucrY2eDA]{Giant Wolf Spider} (50XP each)
  • 5@Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.4udpeEneFSZK9NTB]{Swarm of Spiders} (100XP each)

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes

text.content:
The East Gate is a fortified entrance to the city often used by merchants and traders. It features two large towers with archer posts connected by a 30 foot wall with portcullis. There is a bridge traversing the river, which can be burned in emergencies in order to close off access.

Inside the northern tower is a winch for controlling the portcullis.

 

 

Modules in use:

- Ambient Doors: Provides a satisfying close/open sound to the portcullis.

- Token Attacher: useful for moving or replacing prefabs.

- Levels, Better Roofs and Wall Height for the upper floors of the buildings

- Monk's Active Tiles: Powers the winch in the northern tower. This winch, if clicked by a player, will toggle the portcullis between opened and closed. Click twice to unlock the portcullis.

 

Other suggestions:

- CUSTOMIZE: Rearrange the map as you like using the tiles. Double-click any tile to see the path to more assets. You can also delete the prefab buildings and replace with anything else from the prefab library! Try adding some tactical elements or even a basement or dungeon in the scene or in the scene margins (using Active Tiles or Multilevel token to teleport players)

- OPTIMIZE: If you want to optimize your scene, try using the Tile Flattener feature of DF Architect module. This will turn all of the separate tiles into a single background tile! Best to use Chrome for this since it gives you the very efficient WEBP option. see my tutorial on DF Architect for more info. When you're done customizing, you can also use the "Delete All Control Tokens" macro to unattach everything and delete control tokens. Be careful, you can't undo this!

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/Castles

text.content:
The organ is on a track, obscured by the rug. Upon careful inspection, the party can pull the organ from the wall revealing a secret door.

The organ is a prefab using Token Attacher, using the actor select tool, click the control token for the organ and move it forward to move the organ image and the walls preventing player movement from the wall.

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/Castles

text.content:
Hidden in the closet in the guestquarters is a secret door that leads up into the alchemy room above. The single dusty cloak indicates the proper coathook to pull to have the ladder descend and allow access for the party.

If approaching the trapdoor from the alchemy room, only a cursory investigation is needed to identify the well traveled trapdoor as there are clear footprints and disturbances in the dust.

Both zones are marked by multi-level teleport zones, just drag the appropriate "Ladder Up" or "Trapdoor Down" journal entries into the drawing zones.

text.content:
The Crypt hidden under the mausoleum

Highlights:

  • Ambience by Michael Ghelfi https://www.patreon.com/MichaelGhelfi
  • Moveable and changeable elements
  • Heavy metal gates can be opened/closed
  • The crypt in the main area can be customized. It currently has a secret ladder leading to wherever you like
  • Ineractive Crypts and Teleport to @Compendium[baileywiki-city-district-03-temples.maps.w0nlxTjem935UkG4]{Graveyard Mausoleum Above}

 

Modules in Use:

  • Monk's Active Tiles
  • Multiface Tiles
  • FXMaster

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/Docks

text.content:
The marketplace at the docks is always bustling with activity. New shipments of both mundane and exotic wares arrive daily, sold in the market stalls, which also feature a fortune teller.

 

A guard tower stands watch over the market, and a small tavern and inn are available for the traveler not picky where they lay their head. A staircase behind the tavern leads to a small, dirty set of rooms on the second floor.

 

 

Modules in use:

- Token Attacher: useful for moving or replacing market stalls.

- Levels, Better Roofs and Wall Height for the upper floors of the buildings

 

Other suggestions:

- CUSTOMIZE: Rearrange the docks as you like using the tiles. Double-click any dock tile to see the path to more assets. You can also delete the prefab buildings and replace with anything else from the prefab library! Want to add some vendors? Try dropping in a stall from the "market" collection.

- ADD BOATS: Drop in ships and boats from Forgotten Adventures or Tom Cartos to quickly populate your docks. If you use Token Magic FX module, you can add a drop shadow to those boats.

- OPTIMIZE: If you want to optimize your scene, try using the Tile Flattener feature of DF Architect module. This will turn all of the separate tiles into a single background tile! Best to use Chrome for this since it gives you the very efficient WEBP option. see my tutorial on DF Architect for more info. When you're done customizing, you can also use the "Delete All Control Tokens" macro to unattach everything and delete control tokens. Be careful, you can't undo this!

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/Ships

text.content:
Welcome. I'm Baileywiki, and thanks for trying out my maps for Foundry VTT. Some things you want to know:

UPDATE 10/22/20: Now using core Foundry lighting so Dancing Lights module is no longer needed.

These Maps Be Upgradable!

These maps are all free. But most of these maps also have (or will have) the ability to be upgraded and customized. Clear out a dilapidated mansion and then work to take it over as a base. Turn a wizard's room into a cleric's temple... or a druid's garden. Commandeer a sailing vessel and upgrade it over time.

I have a Patreon for fans who value this kind of extensibility of game play at https://www.patreon.com/baileywiki 

 

Modules in Use

The Baileywiki modules use a variety of 3rd party modules to make the technical magic possible. The current list of Required and Recommended modules can be found in this section of the Baileywiki Installation Guide & FAQ.

While only Token Attacher and Libwrapper are required, we highly recommend you use one of the suggested Module Loadouts to make the most of the technical features within the module.

 

About the Galleon Airship

For a complete walkthrough of the Airship, see this YouTube video.

This is a mighty 6-level sailing vessel meant to serve as a battlemap and base of operations for your crew. This map is available initially as a "Single Map". While I can deploy it as a multi-scene map, a Single Map might be better for combat and to cut down on load times for your players. Plus it lets you control weather and lighting from one map instead of 6 of them. 

If you have already introduced your players to the Galleon, the Airship makes a perfect upgrade.

Modules in Use: Multilevel Token hotspots are in place, including the Hold and the Decks. Parallaxia is there to move the water under your ship (which you can turn off with a macro, or replace it with another map). And FXMaster for creating lovely clouds rolling by.

Special Use of Multilevel Token: On the main deck are special MLT zones. Some on the Decks and a big zone in the water. You can place actors anywhere on this Main Deck screen, and they will "project" to the same spot from other screens. 

Special Use of Ambient Sounds: In each level of the Galleon you can hear airship sounds whenever you select a token. These sounds become louder or more muffled as you exit/enter cabins or go further below deck. They are the loudest on the Main Deck outside.

Alternative Layouts: You can use all of the artwork in the module folder to split the Galleon across 6 different scenes, or message me through Patreon if you'd like to see it distributed through the module that way.

Available Upgrades: The main deck of the Airship is free to anyone. But the lower levels, arcane cannon upgrade, openning/closing cargo hold, are available to Patreons. 

Communicate with me anytime at my Discord or via Patreon. 

 

About the Main Deck Outside

The Main Deck Outside features:

  1. Staircases to various tiers
  2. Spinning propeller and engine sounds as you get closer
  3. Projection regions on each deck project Actor tokens to other levels of the airship
  4. Various doors (marked by a subtle mounted torch), to enter the Map Room, Mess Hall and Captain's quarters.
  5. Arcana thrusters featuring Foundry 7.5 lighting

Try changing the weather and night/day modes to mix things up!

 

About the Main Deck Rooms and Captains Quarters

The Main Deck includes a Map Room on the left-hand side, and the Mess Hall  on the right-hand-side, both accessible doors subtly marked by mounted torches on the Main Deck Outside. Players can access the below decks from either area.

The Captains Quarters can be reached from the Main Deck Outside. Look for the subtle mounted torch that marks the doorway.

 

About the Gun Deck, Hold and Crew Quarters

The gun deck features a full armarment of cannons and a crew lounge/meeting area. There is also a large openning in the middle of the deck where players can see down into the Hold below. 

There are three special Multilevel Token regions over this hole. They not only project players from down below, but a player can also jump into the hole, and they will be teleported to the Hold.

There are multilple staircases/ladders from this level to the levels above and below.

There is also a brig to the far left-hand side of the Hold/Quarters level.

The Airship features additional windows in the living quarters and a breathtaking balcony off the back of the ship.

 

The Bilge

The Airship Bilge is not just for looks. It's been outfitted with a set of doors that can be opened. There is a Multilevel Token Hotspot in that opening to transport your users to whatever map you have waiting for them.

text.content:
Welcome. I'm Baileywiki, and thanks for trying out my maps for Foundry VTT. Some things you want to know:

UPDATE 10/22/20: Now using core Foundry lighting so Dancing Lights module is no longer needed.

These Maps Be Upgradable!

These maps are all free. But most of these maps also have (or will have) the ability to be upgraded and customized. Clear out a dilapidated mansion and then work to take it over as a base. Turn a wizard's room into a cleric's temple... or a druid's garden. Commandeer a sailing vessel and upgrade it over time.

I have a Patreon for fans who value this kind of extensibility of game play at https://www.patreon.com/baileywiki 

 

Modules in Use

The Baileywiki modules use a variety of 3rd party modules to make the technical magic possible. The current list of Required and Recommended modules can be found in this section of the Baileywiki Installation Guide & FAQ.

While only Token Attacher and Libwrapper are required, we highly recommend you use one of the suggested Module Loadouts to make the most of the technical features within the module.

 

About the Keep

For a complete walkthrough of the Keep, watch the YouTube Video. (Spoilers ahead!)

This is a 6-level Keep (the main building within a castle area), meant to serve as a central hub for your story. Clear out a bad guy, make it base, or just interact with NPCs to some interesting end.

Modules in Use: Multilevel Token hotspots are in place to teleport your players around and to project them from level to another. And FXMaster for creating clouds, weather, bats and general ambieance. 

Special Use of Ambient Sounds: In each level of the Keep you can hear crackling fires, dripping water and wind (when standing outside on the roof levels).

 

Available Upgrades: The Keep has two main upgrades, both available on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/baileywiki 

 

First, the first 3 levels of the Keep are free to everyone. The basement and top levels are only available to Patreons. There are also alternative rooms available for the basement, as well as a murder room and a wizard's tower.

Second, the Keep is available in an "infested" version, ready for an epic dungeon crawl. Check out the Journal entry for the Infested Keep for more details.

 

Communicate with me anytime at my Discord or via Patreon. 

 

Important DM Notes for Advanced Functionality

Activating Teleports: Install and activate Multilevel Token. To actually trigger a teleport, a token must be standing in the hot spot and click on the Journal Entry in that zone.

Load All Maps. You must load the other Infested Keep maps in order to get all teleports to work. Otherwise, they have no maps to teleport to.

 

List of Rooms/Features

LVL0 Basement: Dungeon, Torture Room, Secret Tunnel, Pantry/Ale Storage, Crypt (with 3 alternate versions)

LVL1 Great Hall: Kitchen, Dining Room, Bathroom, Study, Secret Passage Behind Throne

LVL2 Guest Rooms: Living Quarters, Lounge, Murder Room (alternate version)

LVL3 Ballroom: Library, Guest Quarters

LVL4: Garden: Rooftop Garden, Servants Quarters, Guards Quarters, Armory, Smithy

LVL5: Battlements: Balcony, Treasure Room, Wizard's Room (alternate version)

LVL6: Towers: Includes Wizard's Observatory Tower (alternatve version)

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Quick Encounters#/CF_SEP/The Hideout

text.content:
Quick Encounter

 

CW: Child Death

 

This tomb is the crypt of Lady Cochraine. She passed away decades, or perhaps even centuries, ago. Her life was a tragic one, losing her husband in a hunting disaster, then her young children shortly thereafter. While she continued to care for the people of the nearby town in life, she had lost much of her fighting spirit. When a plague struck the town long ago, she passed and was interred with her children.

When her crypt is accessed via the Rune Door, Lady Cochraine is wary and prepared to fight, but does not immediately engage. If the party approaches the situation diplomatically, she can aid them in the form of direct combat support,  scouting, or going to find additional help. She has a strong bond with the surrounding wilderness and would likely bring nearby fauna.

 

  • 1@Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.qoFEjfrANBdrCP6m]{Ghost} (1100XP each)

pages.name: Figure: City of the Dead Above

text.content:
City of the Dead 

A beautiful graveyard at the edge of the city. 

 

Highlights:

  • Made of modular components which can be swapped out
  • Various background tile alternatives
  • Mausoleums feature staircases that lead to the crypts below (MATT-powered)
  • Crypt lids and interiors can be customized (Multiface tiles) and removed with GM double-click

 

Modules in Use:

  • Monk's Active Tiles for stair case teleports and crypt lids
  • FXMaster for weather
  • Multiface Tiles to quickly right-click and swap gravestone and other artwork
  • Better Roofs and Wall Height

Welcome. I'm Baileywiki, and thanks for trying out my maps for Foundry VTT. Some things you want to know:

This Journal Entry is a general guide for using the Modular Town System and my maps. For the most up to date information  and guides, always check the Baileywiki Installation Guide & FAQ and the Baileywiki Modular System Guide for the change logs.

 

Video Guides

You can view release videos, system guides, and advanced tutorials on the Baileywiki YouTube Channel. Below are some helpful videos and playlists to have handy when getting started.

  • Installation and Getting Started Guide
  • Playlist of Release Videos: Modular System Releases
  • Playlist of guides to using the Modular system: Building with the Modular System
  • Playslist of Modular Map Walkthroughs: Baileywiki Map Walkthroughs
    • note: Many of these videos are for scenes and maps in the Baileywiki Maps Premium module, if you think that you are missing one of the maps in the playlist, check the scenes compendium for Maps Premium.

 

Quick Tips

  1. IMPORT MACROS: Import all of the macros from the Premium Towns macro compendium, this will ensure that all of the extra features work. You only need to repeat this process if a specific macro is updated (see change notes)
  2. AGREE TO THE PROMPT: Say "yes" to the prompt to import compendium data into your Compendium tab. This is a special "system agnostic" Actor compendium that will be refreshed every time there is a new release.
  3. DELETE UNNEEDED ACTORS AND SCENES: Importing a large amount of scenes and actors can cause high load times and server instability. Only import scenes and prefabs that you are actively using. Once you have finished using prefabs to build a scene, delete the actors from your actor directory.

 

Modules in Use

The Baileywiki modules use a variety of 3rd party modules to make the technical magic possible. The current list of Required and Recommended modules can be found in this section of the Baileywiki Installation Guide & FAQ.

While only Token Attacher and Libwrapper are required, we highly recommend you use one of the suggested Module Loadouts to make the most of the technical features within the module.

 

About the Modular Town

The Modular Town is a whole system for easily crating  town and city-based maps for either roleplay or battlemaps, complete with tactical elements, many different store and builing types, and even alternative terrains, weather and ambient loops.

 

Premium Version:

The premium Modular Town includes many building types, both low, middle, and high-class structures. There are also a lot of tactical map elements like trees, stairs, garbage cans, street lights, and much more, all pre-lit with foundry walls, lighting and sounds where applicable.

There are also Facades, which are deployable buildings that can be linked to much large maps, like the Keep, the Tavern or the Tower. Just link them with Multilevel Token and your players can teleport directly to those maps.

Sample Maps: While you can easily create your own town maps with the included elements and the "template" scenes in the compendium, you can also use pre-built 'sample' maps that are included in the Scenes compendium.

Special Use of Token Attacher: The modular town system relies heavily on the Token Attacher module. This module allows you to deploy assets from the Actor compendium complete with walls, lights and sounds, which can be rotated and moved altogether. Make your own custom assets or change the configuration of the ones I include in the pack to match your style of play.

Performance Considerations: The larger your map and the more elements you include, the more performance will suffer. Consider making a series of small maps that you link together with Multilevel Token module. Also, modules like FXMaster can be amazing for weather elements, or Token Magic FX for cool tile and token effects, but you can turn them off for immediate performance gains.

 

Communicate with me anytime at my Discord or via Patreon. 

Asset and Update Information

Changelogs

Changelogs can be viewed under the Modular Town Releases section of the Baileywiki Modular System Guide.

Included Assets

A summary of the Modular Town assets can be viewed under the Modular Town Assets section of the Baileywiki Modular System Guide.

All of the artwork and sounds within the module can be found in the path. You'll find tiles, thumbnails, and icons in the "maps" subfolder and the sounds under the "sounds" subfolder.

The extra assets are great for building your own scenes without using the prefab actors. You will also occasionally find easter eggs for future releases in the folders, so be sure to look through the asset files regularly.

 

Additional Tips

  1. Don't delete multiple control tokens at once. Do it one at a time or you'll get artifacts. 
  2. Hold CTR when rotating assets or use the arrow keys to quickly rotate them 
  3. If after placing an asset the image is laying on top of another image, use the Tile tool to move it to the back. it won't hurt anything
  4. There are many ambient sounds and some loops included in the module files. Check em out.
  5. Instead of using the Actor assets, you can deploy images directly from the module files
  6. When you are done setting up your scene, "select all" actors and then right click one of them to make all of the control tokens invisible to your players
  7. Use walls to close off parts of the map to your players 

 

Have a Problem or Questions? 

Communicate with me anytime at my Discord (best) or via Patreon.

As the party nears the peak of the main tower, a loud, rhythmic thumping echoes in time to the crimson glow that has permeated the stairs. They behold the source of both the sound and the light: a massive crystaline heart. The heart fuels some of the Lord of the Castle's abilities, as such, it is guarded not only by the castle's perplexing layout, but by a swarm of flying swords that immediately strike out at any who dare to approach the heart.

As the party gazes up, they realize that some of the gargoyles are staring right back at them. With the slow grinding sound of stone-on-stone, four of the North Tower's gargoyles awaken fully and take flight to assault the party.

Your tokens (and/or tiles) and their positions have been saved in this Journal Entry and replaced with a single Quick Encounter Note. To run the Quick Encounter, double-click the Map Note icon and then click the Run Quick Encounter button.

Quick Encounter

As the party makes their way down to the first of the lower levels of the keep, they encounter the source of the shadows they faced earlier. When the Lord of the Castle first succumbed to his Dark Gift, many of the guards and soldiers rebelled. He slaughtered them wholeslae here in their former quarters. Now their tortured souls have given rise to a small army of shadows that attempt to drain the very essence of the party.

 

Note: 8 shadows is a large amount to deal with for even the most prepared of adventurers, if the party is lacking in area of effect attacks, it's recommended to have the shadows move slowly between the rooms to give the party a chance to dispatch them in groups, rather than having to contend with all of them at once.

Seated on the slightly stained and discolored furniture of the guest quarters are three vampire spawn. These poor creatures have fallen out of favor with the Lord in some way or another and are not immediately hostile to the party. They may aid the party in deposing the Lord of the Castle, should the party persuade the spawn that it's a winning proposition. Or, the spawn may attack the party if they sense that the Lord might return them to their former status within the castle.

text.content:
Welcome. I'm Baileywiki, and thanks for trying out my maps for Foundry VTT. Some things you want to know:

UPDATE 10/22/20: Now using core Foundry lighting so Dancing Lights module is no longer needed.

 

These Maps Be Upgradable!

These maps are all free. But most of these maps also have (or will have) the ability to be upgraded and customized. Clear out a dilapidated mansion and then work to take it over as a base. Turn a wizard's room into a cleric's temple... or a druid's garden. Commandeer a sailing vessel and upgrade it over time.

I have a Patreon for fans who value this kind of extensibility of game play at https://www.patreon.com/baileywiki 

 

Modules in Use (Optional)

Whenever possible, I use the following modules. You'll want to get your hands on them for the full effect:

  • Multilevel Tokens: I create automatic teleport points to get your players around the map. I also project players from one level so players on another level can see them.
  • Token Magic FX: Special effects on some maps, including a shimming effect on the Pocket Dimension Mansion.
  • Parallaxia: This module lets you animate tiles, like water running by and other nifty things.
  • FXMaster: Lots of great weather and special effects for your maps.

 

About the Mansion

The Mansion comes in two varieties, "normal" and Pocket Dimension (Mordenkainen). But you can further customize the landscape.

Landscape Customization: Just to go into the source files in the module and look from Snow, Grass or Void terrains. Make these the background or drop them in as a PNG. 

Transparent PNGs: You also have the PNG files for each level in case you want to drop them into another map.

Modules in Use: If you have Multilevel Tokens, Dancing Lights and Token Magic FX, you'll find those all work on this map. Also, Token Magic FX is used in the Pocket Mansion in order to shimmer the background.

 

Available Upgrades

Patreons get snap-in PNGs to turn every section of the Mansion into a ruined wreck or to unfurnish everything. Plus lots of alternative rooms like a pool, billiards room, pet room, druid's garden, sparring room, cleric's temple and more!

Remember, the Mansion has 3 levels. If you import all 3 levels, the teleports should work.

Communicate with me anytime at my Discord or via Patreon.

 

About the Mansion Level 1

The first level of the mansion features a number of staircases with automatic teleportation and the following areas:

  1. Foyer/entrance (featuring Multilevel Token projection area)
  2. Hallways and lounge
  3. Tower with war room (bottom-left)
  4. Bedrooms
  5. Kitchen (top-right)
  6. Dining Room (featuring Multilevel Token projection area)
  7. Library (top-left)

Welcome. I'm Baileywiki, and thanks for trying out my maps for Foundry VTT. Some things you want to know:

 

GM Walkthrough Video

Best to watch the walkthrough video.

It's important to watch this video for a primer on all the advanced functionality in this map. There is a lot more going on here than simple walls and lights!

 

Quick Tips

    1. The Multi-Level Token zones are controlled via map notes. Make sure that both you and your players have Map Notes Display set to True.
    2. If you would like to control whether players can use a specific zone, you can change the permissions of the given map note by changing between the @Compendium[baileywiki-nuts-and-bolts.journals.Ii2M77LabDmpHbGt]{stair} and @Compendium[baileywiki-nuts-and-bolts.journals.Ic3LUzSx7smMJBoB]{gm-only} journal entries. If you are using Scene Packer, then these entries will be imported and linked automatically.
    3. Many of the tiles, lights, drawings and sounds are locked in place by Token Attacher module. Use Token Attacher's Quick Edit mode to move most things around.

 

Modules in Use

The Baileywiki modules use a variety of 3rd party modules to make the technical magic possible. The current list of Required and Recommended modules can be found in this section of the Baileywiki Installation Guide & FAQ.

While only Token Attacher and Libwrapper are required, we highly recommend you use one of the suggested Module Loadouts to make the most of the technical features within the module.

 

About the Farmhouse

The Farmhouse comes in three motifs: Harvest, Fallow and Snowy. It's also available as a modular map in the Modular Town system, in case you want to reconfigure it or reuse its assets in other maps.

 

Free Version:

Premium Version:

The premium version has all three versions of the Farmhouse, as well as a cornfield that your players can explore, and where you can hide treasure, and encounter, a cave, or any other surprises.

text.content:
City of the Dead Crypts

Various secrets lay below the cemetery. 

Highlights:

  • Ambience by Michael Ghelfi https://www.patreon.com/MichaelGhelfi
    • Located in modules/baileywiki-maps-premium-towns/sounds/ambiences/michael-ghelfi
  • All scenes are modular, with special Dungeon Draw 'crypt' theme 
  • 4 Separate Crypts (in clockwork order starting top-right, 1, 2, 3, 4)
  • Crypt 1:
    • Boss fight. The only way in is to discover the secret ladder inside the crypt above. 
    • Removeable crypt lids and customizeable interiors. Use your own tiles, too!
    • Torches light up when players click them. (Use Multiface tiles to switch to static flames instead of animated)
    • Magic lights and sound emanate from the central crypt when players approach
  • Crypt 2: 
    • Changeable and removeable crypt lid
    • Lighting effects
  • Crypt 3:
    • Interactable torch. Players can click to light it. Consider making it an easier DC check if they try to perceive the hidden door to the main crypt
    • Changeable/removeable crypt lid, customizeable interior
    • Ineractable torches
  • Crypt 4:
    • Interactable crypts
    • Interactable torch'

 

Modules in Use

  • Monk's Active Tiles for interactive elements and teleports
  • Multiface Tiles for quickly changing artwork
  • FXMaster for fog and embers effect

pages.name: Quick Encounter: The Poachers' Blood Room

text.content:
Quick Encounter

The Poachers' Blood Room is filled with viscera from the group's kills. If the poachers are snuck up on, the party will find them working on butchering and breaking down animal corpses for sale on the black market. A stealthy approach would be difficult, but doable if approached from the correct angle while taking advantage of the pillars and crates in the room.

The leader of the poachers has abilities comparable to a Druid, but certainly not the same reverence for nature. The Druid commands the other poachers in battle and is clearly the primary source of tactics and decision making. If the party eliminates the Druid leader, the other poachers are much more likely to lay down their arms and be taken into custody.

text.content:
Quick Encounter

 

CW: Child Death

 

This tomb is the crypt of Lady Cochraine. She passed away decades, or perhaps even centuries, ago. Her life was a tragic one, losing her husband in a hunting disaster, then her young children shortly thereafter. While she continued to care for the people of the nearby town in life, she had lost much of her fighting spirit. When a plague struck the town long ago, she passed and was interred with her children.

With the loss of her own children, Lady Cochraine is a staunch protector of the young. The party will find two of the three lost children taking shelter with her, having been let in after escaping the cultists. With charges to protect, Lady Cochraine is prepared to fight any who would harm the children and does not immediately trust the party. The party needs to convince the children in order to have the help of Lady Cochraine.

Lady Cochraine's top priority is protecting the lost children. While they are there, Lady Cochraine will not leave her tomb except for in dire circumstances. If the party discovers the cult's plan to sacrifice the third child in a ritual, Lady Cochraine can be convinced to help in the battle and rescue attempt.

  • 1@Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.qoFEjfrANBdrCP6m]{Ghost} (1100XP each)

Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/Ships

text.content:
Welcome. I'm Baileywiki, and thanks for trying out my maps for Foundry VTT. Some things you want to know:

 

For a complete walkthrough and GM tutorial of the Frigate, go here.

 

These Maps Be Upgradable!

These maps are all free. But most of these maps also have the ability to be upgraded and customized. Clear out a dilapidated mansion and then work to take it over as a base. Turn a wizard's room into a cleric's temple... or a druid's garden. Commandeer a sailing vessel and upgrade it over time.

You also get more levels, more rooms, more effects and even deployable assets to go with your maps.

I have a Patreon for fans who value this kind of extensibility of game play at https://www.patreon.com/baileywiki 

 

Quick Tips

  1. The Multi-Level Token zones are controlled via map notes. Make sure that both you and your players have Map Notes Display set to True.
  2. If you would like to control whether players can use a specific zone, you can change the permissions of the given map note by changing between the @Compendium[baileywiki-maps-premium.journals.Jy46aEPppzhz5Rqn]{stair} and @JournalEntry[JL767aPVxqeZatHy]{gm-only} journal entries. If you are using Scene Packer, then these entries will be imported and linked automatically.
  3. Many of the tiles, lights, drawings and sounds are locked in place by Token Attacher module. Use Token Attacher's Quick Edit mode to move most things around.

 

Modules in Use

The Baileywiki modules use a variety of 3rd party modules to make the technical magic possible. The current list of Required and Recommended modules can be found in this section of the Baileywiki Installation Guide & FAQ.

While only Token Attacher and Libwrapper are required, we highly recommend you use one of the suggested Module Loadouts to make the most of the technical features within the module.

 

About the Frigate

The Frigate is a warring and escore vessel. Full of guns and low to the waterline, Frigates can keep fighting when other ships are capsizing. 

 

Free Version: 

The free map features the top level of the "light Frigate", which is ideal for an at-sea battle, and ambient sounds and dynamic lighting.

Modules in Use: FXMaster for creating lovely clouds rolling by.

 

Premium Version:

The premium Frigate comes in both light and dark versions and another 2 levels: Gun Deck with Captains Quarters, and the Lower Decks with Crew Quarters and Hold. It is also deployable from the Actor compendium so you can place your Frigate on any map. This version is perfect for exploring and storytelling, and for making the Frigate a base of operations or a recurring location for your players.

Modules in Use: Multilevel Token hotspots are in place to teleport your players to lower decks. Parallaxia is there to move the water under your ship. And FXMaster for creating lovely clouds rolling by. Token Attacher is used to delete the Main Deck from this map and drop it on any other map you like! Find it in your Actor Compendium. Finally, Vehicles and Mechanisms functionality is built in if you'd like your Frigate to automatically pick up tokens and move them along in a naval battle.

Special Use of Multilevel Token: On the main deck is a special MLT zone that "projects" tokens standing in the Hold area. This map is set up to require a player to click a journal entry over the stairs in order to activate the teleport. Make sure you have made journal entries visible!

Special Use of Ambient Sounds: In each level of the Galleon you can hear sailing sounds whenever you select a token. These sounds become louder or more muffled as you exit/enter cabins or go further below deck. They are the loudest on the Main Deck outside.

Communicate with me anytime at my Discord or via Patreon. 

 

About the Main Deck Outside

The Main Deck Outside features:

  1. Staircases with teleport zones (remember to click the journal entry to activate)
  2. A Multilevel Token zone that 'projects' tokens from the Gun Deck to the top deck. 
  3. Vehicles and Mechanisms region that will automatically capture tokens and carry them with the ship
  4. A Token Attacher "Control Token", which looks like an Anchor. If you have TA installed and active, you can delete this token and see the whole deck disappear. Then you can redeploy the top deck into any other map (using the Actor Compendium), and you can STILL teleport back to the lower decks whenver you want. Just make sure you only have one "main deck" deployed in your world and only one "lower decks" scene in your world.

 

Have a Problem or Questions? 

Communicate with me anytime at my Discord (best) or via Patreon.

text.content:
The North Tower Shaft spans 300 feet from @Compendium[baileywiki-maps-premium-towns.maps.AF3z2j7rlAaWmnWh]{Castle Gothic Level B2} to @Compendium[baileywiki-maps-premium-towns.maps.DAbGTRZcFz4V7lVb]{Castle Gothic Level 04}. While difficult, it would be possible to climb up or down it with the proper equipment or spells.

 

Vampire Spawn and Bats travel through the shaft starting at dusk every day and return the following dawn. The chittering of the bats can be heard through small cracks in the shaft walls during these hours.

 

The top of the shaft on @Compendium[baileywiki-maps-premium-towns.maps.DAbGTRZcFz4V7lVb]{Castle Gothic Level 04} has an automatic, one-way multilevel token teleporter down to @Compendium[baileywiki-maps-premium-towns.maps.AF3z2j7rlAaWmnWh]{Castle Gothic Level B2}. If you are running a combat on this scene and are worried about things falling down in the middle of it, consider removing the zone, clicking the "disable region" checkbox or switching it to "activate on map note" on the multilevel tab of the drawing configuration.

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/Castles

text.content:
There is a slide trap that will activate and send players down into one of the wings of the dungeon. If the players inspect very carefully, they may be able to avoid it.

 

When "armed," the trap drawings will have a slight red tint to them (not visible to the players). When "disarmed," the trap drawings will have no tint. Armed traps will not have the "disable region" checkbox on the MLT section of their drawing configuration checked. If you would like to adjust the color or opacity of the tint, edit the macro mentioned below.

 

To toggle the trap between "armed" and "disarmed," run the @Compendium[baileywiki-maps-premium-towns.macros.5p9Ua0dIUpLKw3al]{arm-disarm-trap-slide} macro.

 

NOTE: For the arm-disarm macro to operate properly, the text labels for the slide trap drawings must read exactly "trap-slide" or the macro will not alter them properly. Do not change the text labels.

Motionless and nigh undetectable, several Gray Oozes sit on the murky floor of this wing of dungeon cells. As the party opens one of the curiously unlocked cells, the oozes awaken and begin to close in on the party, likewise disturbing the shadows of long dead prisoners.

Quick Encounter

The two cultists in charge of keeping the children secure are arguing with each other. Shortly after the leader took one of the children, the other caught the two torturers by surprise with a headbutt, inducing a bloody nose and a quick getaway. These two cultists are debating whose fault this debacle is and are not very aware. If they hear fighting in the rest of the hideout, they will go to their allies.

Quick Encounter

A single poacher (Bandit) is watching the dog kennels. If the poacher is caught unaware, the dogs are locked in their crates and are unable to join the fight until the poacher opens the cages.

Whether the poacher is encountered directly, or they overhear fighting in the rest of the Hideout, they will take their first full turn to unlock the dog kennels and release them. If this poacher is defeated before their first round of combat, another poacher may open the dog kennels, otherwise the dogs will remain caged.

text.content:
Welcome to the Modular City and its first District. This is a massive project aimed at creating a sprawling city, district by district for use in your games. Alongside the scenes are a collection of modular and deployable pieces for you to customize the city, or expand it to fit your design.

Note: Many of the assets in this module require the Baileywiki Modular Towns module, while some scenes work fine without, you will want to have a copy of that module installed to access all of the features.

 

Where to Find Things

Everything you need is within the Baileywiki Modular City compendiums. Scenes, Journal Entries, and Macros can be found in their appropriate compendiums, and to find deployable prefabs, check the Actors compendium. For Dungeon Draw enabled scenes (Sewer scenes not marked as "Optimized") and using the Dungeon Draw themes yourself, make sure to import the dd-custom-themes file to your dungeon draw installation.

If you're looking for tiles, check your USER DATA modules/baileywiki-city-district-02-docks/tiles for individual art pieces and scene backgrounds. Many overlays and backgrounds are also available in the USER DATA modules/baileywiki-maps-premium-towns/maps/ folder. Check the townsquare/misc2/seating-objects folder for all of the extra overlays.

Key Features

The Modular City includes the following:

  • Deployable Rooms and Sewer Pieces (prefabs and tiles)
  • Dungeon Draw Themes for creating your own sewers
  • Deployable Buildings (prefabs)
  • Modular docks pieces to create custom docks (tiles)
  • Feature Sewers and Docks (scenes)
  • Feature Buildings (scenes)

 

Modules in Use

  • Multiface Tiles. Right-click a room to see if you can change it out (GM  only)
  • Dungeon Draw: Use dungeon draw to connect sewer rooms, add water, and further customize the layout of sewers. Be sure to import the custom DD settings from the module first!
  • Levels / Better Roofs / Wall Height: The triumverate of modules for 3-dimensional mapping
  • FXMaster: Clouds rolling by
  • Monk's Active Tile Triggers with Tagger. Powers teleports and the controls in the margin of the scene
  • Token Magic FX. Creates a satisfying drop shadow on roofs.
  • Token Attacher. For prefabs.

 

For support, find me on Discord.

text.content:
Your tokens (and/or tiles) and their positions have been saved in this Journal Entry and replaced with a single Quick Encounter Note. To run the Quick Encounter, double-click the Map Note icon and then click the Run Quick Encounter button.

Quick Encounter

As the party leaves the landing and proceeds north towards the catacombs, they hear a sickening, squelching sound behind them: a Gelatinous Cube has moved from beneath the stairs to the upper basement and is advancing upon the party, blocking the stairs to the landing. The cube pursues the party towards the slide trap down the hall. Once the slide is activated it continues to the edge of the slide before beginning to move back to it's position beneath the stairs.

Consider making this Gelatinous Cube more formiddable based upon the party, the cube is not necessarily a combat encounter, but a bit of "encouragement" to have the party encounter the slide trap a little less prepared.

 

  • 1@Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.3fzQVYQhXxCXRa2o]{Gelatinous Cube} (450XP each)

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/The Hideout

text.content:
note: these sections use the "secret" formatting, only owners of the journal entry can read the grayed out sections. You can safely show this entry to players without them seeing the secret text describing the mechanics of the entry.

This runic door is powered by Monk's Active Tile Triggers. Click the "switch" tile above the door while in your token tool to activate the door causing the following:

  1. A sound will play
  2. The dancing lights will turn off/on
  3. The secret door will open/close
  4. The runic portion of the door will hide/show for players

These are all toggle effects, so clicking again will "reset" the door.

 

A large stone door fills the end of the passage. Carefully engraved on it are a series of intricate runes, pulsating with magical energy. The centerpiece of the door is a small inscription, though it appears in complete...

 

You can use any riddle, story, or poem you like in conjunction with this tile and manually activate it to toggle the door. One possible option is "_____ is not the end." with the solution of "Death," a fitting puzzle for unlocking a door to a ghost's tomb. Alternatively, "____ is not goodbye. It is ____ we _____ again" with "death, until, meet" as a solution.

 

Any word puzzle can be approached in a few ways. You may decide to only indicate where there is space then offer up character counts (ie: two 5 letter words, then a 4 letter word) upon successful language or perception checks and additional contextual information with history or insight.

text.content:
Welcome. I'm Baileywiki, and thanks for trying out my maps for Foundry VTT. Some things you want to know:

UPDATE 10/22/20: Now using core Foundry lighting so Dancing Lights module is no longer needed.

These Maps Be Upgradable!

These maps are all free. But most of these maps also have (or will have) the ability to be upgraded and customized. Clear out a dilapidated mansion and then work to take it over as a base. Turn a wizard's room into a cleric's temple... or a druid's garden. Commandeer a sailing vessel and upgrade it over time.

I have a Patreon for fans who value this kind of extensibility of game play at https://www.patreon.com/baileywiki 

 

Modules in Use

The Baileywiki modules use a variety of 3rd party modules to make the technical magic possible. The current list of Required and Recommended modules can be found in this section of the Baileywiki Installation Guide & FAQ.

While only Token Attacher and Libwrapper are required, we highly recommend you use one of the suggested Module Loadouts to make the most of the technical features within the module.

 

About the Keep

For a complete walkthrough of the Infested Keep, watch the YouTube Video. (Spoilers ahead!)

This is a ruined version of the normal Keep with new surprises a decidedly dower motif. Featuring an eerie ambieance from Michael Ghelfe (Youtube | Patreon) and new surprises.

Modules in Use: Multilevel Token hotspots are in place to teleport your players around and to project them from level to another. And FXMaster for creating clouds, weather, bats and general ambieance. 

Special Use of Ambient Sounds: In each level of the Keep you can hear crackling fires, dripping water and wind (when standing outside on the roof levels). There is also a magic emination in the ballroom if you use the "Mage" version.

 

Available Upgrades

The Infested Keep is itself an upgrade to the Keep along with the rest of the Keep floors and more great stuff at https://www.patreon.com/baileywiki 

 

Besides the other alternative rooms, you also have 4 alternatives to the main ballroom (see below)!

 

Communicate with me anytime at my Discord or via Patreon. 

 

Important DM Notes for Advanced Functionality

Activating Teleports: Install and activate Multilevel Token. To actually trigger a teleport, a token must be standing in the hot spot and click on the Journal Entry in that zone.

Load All Maps. You must load the other Infested Keep maps in order to get all teleports to work. Otherwise, they have no maps to teleport to. THE EXCEPTION is your Level 3 Ballroom. Just import the version of the ballroom that you want, or else the teleport will randomly teleport you to any of the ballrooms that you have imported.

 

List of Rooms/Features

LVL0 Basement: Dungeon, Torture Room, Secret Tunnel, Pantry/Ale Storage, Crypt (with 3 alternate versions)

LVL1 Great Hall: Kitchen, Dining Room, Bathroom, Study, Secret Passage Behind Throne

LVL2 Guest Rooms: Living Quarters, Lounge

LVL3 Ballroom: Library, Guest Quarters:

           4 Alternatives:

              Campsite

              Treasure Horde

              Magees & Rituals

              Bones & Ghosts

LVL4: Garden: Rooftop Garden, Servants Quarters, Guards Quarters, Armory, Smithy, Arcane Room

LVL5: Battlements: Balcony, Treasure Room, Wizard's Room (alternate version)

LVL6: Towers: Includes Wizard's Observatory Tower (alternatve version)

Trying to catch up on the latest Baileywiki Releases? Click the banner above to visit the Baileywiki Modular System Releases playlist on YouTube, or read through the Baileywiki Premium Modules Change Log.

text.content:
The Manor Alley West is fashioned loosely after Trollskull Alley. It can be used as a connecting point to the Manor Alley East, or as a separate part of a city. There are 3 "Weathers Conditions" available for the alley.

Parts of this scene were constructed using the Baileywiki Modular Towns System to build multi-floor structures and add clutter to the space. If you would like more of these modular elements, become a patron.

 

Walkthrough

A walkthrough of this content and its features is available on YouTube. Check out the full video here.

 

Weather Conditions

  • Peacefull: This "standard" condition featuring peaceful clouds.
  • Muddy: Dirtied up streets during a rainstorm, with appropriate rain and denser cloud cover.
  • Snowy: Drifts and flurries swirl about the snow-covered roofs of this weather condition.

 

Key Features

  • Multistory buildings. There are a total of 5 navigable buildings in the Manor Alley West: A large bookshop or library to the north, two small abodes in the center, a carpenter/woodworker in the south, and a shop featuring an apothecary to the west.
  • Clickable Teleports via Monk's Active Tile Triggers to travel to Manor Alley East
  • Dynamic lighting that also changes when the motif changes
  • Facade buildings throughout the alley, each of which can be swapped out for a real building
  • The chimneys feature animated or still versions of the smoke, using the control panel

 

Modules in Use

  • Levels / Better Roofs / Wall Height: The triumverate of modules for 3-dimensional mapping
  • FXMaster: Clouds rolling by, except for over the navigable buildings.
  • Monk's Active Tile Triggers with Tagger. Powers the controls in the margin of the scene.
  • Token Magic FX. Creates a satisfying drop shadow on roofs.
  • Token Attacher. For prefabs.

 

For support, find me on Discord.

text.content: A peaceful creek babbles through thick trees. A rowboat sits along the southern shore, as an old stone tower rises above the tree canopy on the north shore.

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes

text.content:
This is a 4 story ruin which is a fairly faithful replica of this 3d model. Take full tactical advantage of the space but climbing the 4-story southwest tower, fight your way up the northern towers, or sneak in through one of the southern entrances through the old nobles' quarters. 

Hide the wood bridge, or pull it back and under the z value of the castle to retract it and make for a more difficult entrance. 

Or put a dragon in the courtyard and hide his horde in a secret dungeon under the ruin (use Active Tiles or Multilevel Tokens to teleport to a whole new map!)

 

Modules Required:

 

Token Attacher for manipulating the ruin or for placing it on another map of your choice

Levels, Wall Height and Better Roofs for navigating the multiple levels

 

Other suggestions:

Try out Ripper's 3D Canvas module to see this map in 3 dimensions. You can even enable this view for your players in the Scene config. https://www.patreon.com/theripper93

 

CHANGE THE TERRAIN: Try clicking into the tile config for the Moat, and change it to an elevated terrain instead!

 

ADD FEATURES: Grab the Baileywiki Modular System to drop in prefabs of trees, campfires, and other elements to build a story. Or grab tiles from Forgotten Adventures and Tom Cartos to drop in balista, trap doors, sleeping bags, tents, and other modifications.

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/Ships

text.content:
Welcome. I'm Baileywiki, and thanks for trying out my maps for Foundry VTT. Some things you want to know:

UPDATE 10/22/20: Now using core Foundry lighting so Dancing Lights module is no longer needed.

These Maps Be Upgradable!

These maps are all free. But most of these maps also have (or will have) the ability to be upgraded and customized. Clear out a dilapidated mansion and then work to take it over as a base. Turn a wizard's room into a cleric's temple... or a druid's garden. Commandeer a sailing vessel and upgrade it over time.

I have a Patreon for fans who value this kind of extensibility of game play at https://www.patreon.com/baileywiki 

 

Modules in Use

The Baileywiki modules use a variety of 3rd party modules to make the technical magic possible. The current list of Required and Recommended modules can be found in this section of the Baileywiki Installation Guide & FAQ.

While only Token Attacher and Libwrapper are required, we highly recommend you use one of the suggested Module Loadouts to make the most of the technical features within the module.

 

About the Galleon

This is a mighty 6-level sailing vessel meant to serve as a battlemap and base of operations for your crew. This map is available initially as a "Single Map". While I can deploy it as a multi-scene map, a Single Map might be better for combat and to cut down on load times for your players. Plus it lets you control weather and lighting from one map instead of 6 of them. 

Modules in Use: Multilevel Token hotspots are in place, including the Hold, the Decks and the ocean. See the tips in the map. Parallaxia is there to move the water under your ship. And FXMaster for creating lovely clouds rolling by.

Special Use of Multilevel Token: On the main deck are special MLT zones. Some on the Decks and a big zone in the water. You can place actors anywhere on this Main Deck screen, and they will "project" to the same spot from other screens. This way your players can see each other and enemies from anywhere on the ship (assuming line of sight). You should also be able to target these clones in combat (if you're using the Single Map version). It is important that you don't drop Actors directly in the "projected" hotspots. They won't project to other areas, and you may lose track of where you put them. Just drop them into the Main Deck screen or one of the rooms.

Special Use of Ambient Sounds: In each level of the Galleon you can hear sailing sounds whenever you select a token. These sounds become louder or more muffled as you exit/enter cabins or go further below deck. They are the loudest on the Main Deck outside.

Alternative Layouts: You can use all of the artwork in the module folder to split the Galleon across 6 different scenes, or message me through Patreon if you'd like to see it distributed through the module that way.

Available Upgrades: For Patreons, the Galleon is also available in a Ghost Ship version, an Airship version and it's also available as a Placeable Asset (using the Token Attacher module) so you can drop it into any map. You can also upgrade the forward cannons to Arcane Cannons!

Communicate with me anytime at my Discord or via Patreon. 

 

About the Main Deck Outside

The Main Deck Outside features:

  1. Staircases to various tiers
  2. Teleport hotspots to travel to other rooms and also the birds nest
  3. Projection regions on each deck and in the water to project Actor tokens to all other levels of the galleon 
  4. Various doors (marked by a subtle mounted torch), to enter the Map Room, Mess Hall and Captain's quarters.

Try changing the weather and night/day modes to mix things up!

 

About the Main Deck Rooms and Captains Quarters

The Main Deck includes a Map Room on the left-hand side, and the Mess Hall  on the right-hand-side, both accessible doors subtly marked by mounted torches on the Main Deck Outside. Players can access the below decks from either area.

The Captains Quarters can be reached from the Main Deck Outside. Look for the subtle mounted torch that marks the doorway.

 

About the Gun Deck, Hold and Crew Quarters

The gun deck features a full armarment of cannons and a crew lounge/meeting area. There is also a large openning in the middle of the deck where players can see down into the Hold below. 

There are three special Multilevel Token regions over this hole. They not only project players from down below, but a player can also jump into the hole, and they will be teleported to the Hold.

There are multilple staircases/ladders from this level to the levels above and below.

 

There is also a brig to the far left-hand side of the Hold/Quarters level.

 

The Bilge

Decorate it as you like or feel free to suggest future upgrades via my Patreon.

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/Castles

text.content:
The two bronze statues project a magical barrier, barring entry to the tomb of the king and queen. This barrier was created to defend the tomb against evildoers and defilers, so that only the Lord of the Castle and the worthy may enter.

Whatever you decide for determining worthiness, you can manually move tokens across the invisible wall here, or disable the barrier entirely by using the @Compendium[baileywiki-maps-premium-towns.macros.0u2s188zEcxSrCuc]{Token Attacher - Toggle Quick Edit Mode} macro and deleting the wall (and lights that give the animated effect if you choose).

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/Castles

text.content:
The elevator landing is rigged with pressure plates. If the party enters the elevator car on this level without disabling the trap on @Compendium[baileywiki-maps-premium-towns.maps.OpAF38r64RwPW74F]{Castle Gothic Level 02}, the doors slam shut, locked, and the counterweight is released from the ceiling, sending the entire group with the cart up to @Compendium[baileywiki-maps-premium-towns.maps.IIog9zIN76LS1pRg]{Castle Gothic Level 03}.

 

Make sure you have Level 03 imported before your players activate the trap!

 

If the elevator trap has already been sprung or moved to another level, the pressure plates have no effect.

 

To remove the elevator car from this scene, delete or move the purple control token near the shaft.

 

When "armed," the trap drawings will have a slight red tint to them (not visible to the players). When "disarmed," the trap drawings will have no tint. Armed traps will not have the "disable region" checkbox on the MLT section of their drawing configuration checked. If you would like to adjust the color or opacity of the tint, edit the macro mentioned below.

 

To toggle the trap between "armed" and "disarmed," run the @Compendium[baileywiki-maps-premium-towns.macros.wSsob1ZvJBB3CHKh]{arm-disarm-trap-elevator} macro.

 

NOTE: For the arm-disarm macro to operate properly, the text labels for the slide trap drawings must read exactly "trap-elevator" or the macro will not alter them properly. Do not change the text labels.

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/The Hideout

text.content:
The Cult's Hideout

Accessible via a crumbling ruin and an old stair case, the Cult's Hideout consists of a subterranean complex for a cult consorting with demons and a small cave system complete with mystical crystals.

 

While the Cult's Hideout is designed to be first entered by players via a drop into the ruined tower in the bottom left corrner of the scene, players could also enter througha hidden structure in the wilderness to find the staircase down into the Hideout in the top left portion of the map as well.

 

The cult has been abducting travelers and local townsfolk for human sacrifice. On the day that the party learns of the cult, four children were playing in the ruins near town, when the floor collapsed beneath three of them. The fourth ran back to town to find help and rescue their friends. Before the party arrived, two of the children were abducted by the cult that occupies the caverns, while one managed to hide. This scene is built for a short quest or one shot in a race against the clock to save the children.

 

5e System users will find Quick Encounters throughout the map. The encounters provided are generally suitable for a party of four between levels 3 and 5. Encounters can be made more difficult by allowing enemies to overhear and react from rooms more quickly. There is also a potential diplomatic encounter in the form of the ghost's tomb in the bottom right corner of the map. This makes the map well suited for a short quest or one shot.

 

Modules In Use:

Quick Encounters for 5e encounters. Non-5e users will still be able to read the story prompts of the journal notes, but won't have taillor-made encounters.

Scene Packer to preserve Quick Encounter positional data and make unpacking the scene smooth.

Monk's Active Tile Triggers to power the opening and closing of the crypt door.

 

Other Suggestions

MAKE IT YOURS Use the cabal modular dungeon to add additional rooms, passageways, or traps.
BRING IT TO LIFE Grab the Baileywiki Modular System to create a town and wilderness near the Hideout to suit your one shot or game.

text.content:
What is Dungeon Draw

Dungeon Draw is a powerful tool for creating hallways and tunnels linking together deployable assets, or creating an entire dungeon from scratch. For an overview on all of Dungeon Draw's feature's and general use, see the YouTube video covering it on the Baileywiki Channel.

 

Using Dungeon Draw Custom Themes

In order to use the Dungeon Draw enabled scenes throughout the Baileywiki modules, or to create your own scenes, you'll want to download the Baileywiki Custom Dungeon Draw Themes. You can view the JSON here. To download it, right-click on the page and select "save as." From there, you can import the theme to Dungeon Draw and you are ready to start making scenes!

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Module ReadMe's

text.content:
Welcome to the Modular City and its first District. This is a massive project aimed at creating a sprawling city, district by district for use in your games. Alongside the scenes are a collection of modular and deployable pieces for you to customize the city, or expand it to fit your design.


Note: Many of the assets in this module require the Baileywiki Modular Towns module, while some scenes work fine without, you will want to have a copy of that module installed to access all of the features.

Where to Find Things

Everything you need is within the Baileywiki Modular City compendiums. Scenes, Journal Entries, and Macros can be found in their appropriate compendiums, and to find deployable prefabs, check the Actors compendium.

If you're looking for tiles, check your USER DATA modules/baileywiki-city-district-03-temples/tiles for individual art pieces and scene backgrounds. Many overlays and backgrounds are also available in the USER DATA modules/baileywiki-maps-premium-towns/maps/ folder. Check the townsquare/misc2/seating-objects folder for all of the extra overlays.

Key Features

The Modular City includes the following:

  • Deployable 9 story temples in different themes (prefabs)
  • Feature Buildings (scenes)

 

Modules in Use

  • Multiface Tiles. Right-click a room to see if you can change it out (GM  only)
  • Levels / Better Roofs / Wall Height: The triumverate of modules for 3-dimensional mapping
  • FXMaster: Clouds rolling by, except for over the Manor.
  • Monk's Active Tile Triggers with Tagger. Powers the controls in the margin of the scene.
  • Token Magic FX. Creates a satisfying drop shadow on roofs.
  • Token Attacher. For prefabs.

 

For support, find me on Discord.

cf.path: Baileywiki Nuts and Bolts#/CF_SEP/Scene Notes#/CF_SEP/Mansion

text.content:
Welcome. I'm Baileywiki, and thanks for trying out my maps for Foundry VTT. Some things you want to know:

UPDATE 10/22/20: Now using core Foundry lighting so Dancing Lights module is no longer needed.

These Maps Be Upgradable!

These maps are all free. But most of these maps also have (or will have) the ability to be upgraded and customized. Clear out a dilapidated mansion and then work to take it over as a base. Turn a wizard's room into a cleric's temple... or a druid's garden. Commandeer a sailing vessel and upgrade it over time.

I have a Patreon for fans who value this kind of extensibility of game play at https://www.patreon.com/baileywiki 

 

Modules in Use (Optional)

Whenever possible, I use the following modules. You'll want to get your hands on them for the full effect:

  • Multilevel Tokens: I create automatic teleport points to get your players around the map. I also project players from one level so players on another level can see them.
  • Token Magic FX: Special effects on some maps, including a shimming effect on the Pocket Dimension Mansion.
  • Wall Height: For maps with walls that can be seen under or over by certain players when flying, for example.
  • Parallaxia: This module lets you animate tiles, like water running by and other nifty things.
  • FXMaster: Lots of great weather and special effects for your maps.

 

About the Mansion

The Mansion comes in two varieties, "normal" and Pocket Dimension (Mordenkainen). But you can further customize the landscape.

Landscape Customization: Just to go into the source files in the module and look from Snow, Grass or Void terrains. Make these the background or drop them in as a PNG. 

Transparent PNGs: You also have the PNG files for each level in case you want to drop them into another map.

Modules in Use: If you have Multilevel Tokens, Dancing Lights and Token Magic FX, you'll find those all work on this map. Also, Token Magic FX is used in the Pocket Mansion in order to shimmer the background.

Available Upgrades: Patreons get snap-in PNGs to turn every section of the Mansion into a ruined wreck or to unfurnish everything. Future changes include new room types.

Remember, the Mansion has 3 levels. If you import all 3 levels, the teleports should work.

Communicate with me anytime at my Discord or via Patreon.

 

About the Mansion Basement

The basement is accessible from two routes: (1) the tower in the lower-left corner, and (2) the kitchen in the upper-right corner.

 

The Tower Entrance leads to a dungeon featuring a cell to lock away enemies and a vault to store valuables. 

The Kitchen Entrance leads to a storage room with a secret entrance to a glyph/teleportation room.

text.content:
Your tokens (and/or tiles) and their positions have been saved in this Journal Entry and replaced with a single Quick Encounter Note. To run the Quick Encounter, double-click the Map Note icon and then click the Run Quick Encounter button.

Quick Encounter

Seven cultists gather around the burbling cauldron in this room. They've made a deal with the Lord of the Castle to gain magic power in exchange for their service, but they are not blindly loyal. If they are bested, they will gladly aid the party in the form of information or a few potions of healing.

 

If the cultists are alerted by their familiars, they are able to ready spells and drink potions of invisiblity, laying in wait until the party enters the room.

 

  • 5@Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.qkLNA1lKMMJpxuWg]{Cultist} (25XP each)
  • 2@Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.tYfQIxCJT0WaaKmc]{Cult Fanatic} (450XP each)
